CheckTitle: Ensure Defender for Identity sensors are deployed on Domain Controllers
Description: Microsoft Defender for Identity (MDI) requires sensors to be deployed on Domain Controllers to detect identity-based threats. Without sensors, MDI cannot monitor authentication events, detect lateral movement, or identify credential theft attacks.
Risk: Without deployed MDI sensors, organizations have no visibility into identity-based attacks on Domain Controllers. Attackers can perform Pass-the-Hash, Golden Ticket, Kerberoasting, and other identity attacks without detection, potentially compromising the entire Active Directory infrastructure.

Code.Other:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Defender XDR portal at https://security.microsoft.com/
2. Go to Settings > Identities > Sensors
3. Download the sensor installer package
4. Install the sensor on each Domain Controller
5. Configure the Directory Service account for the sensor
6. Verify the sensor status shows as healthy

Recommendation.Text: Deploy Defender for Identity sensors on all Domain Controllers to enable comprehensive identity threat detection and protect against credential-based attacks.

Notes: This check requires SecurityIdentitiesHealth.Read.All permission. Sensors can be standalone or integrated with Domain Controllers.
